questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.funFact: Paris has been France's capital since 508 CE and is known as the 'City of Light'.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.funFact: Mars appears red because of iron oxide (rust) on its surface!

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.funFact: The Mona Lisa has no visible eyebrows or eyelashes!

questions.question: What is the largest mammal in the world?
questions.funFact: A blue whale's heart is so big that a human could swim through its arteries!

questions.question: Which element has the chemical symbol 'Au'?
questions.funFact: The symbol Au comes from the Latin word for gold, 'aurum'.

questions.question: Which programming language was created by Guido van Rossum?
questions.funFact: Python was named after the British comedy group Monty Python, not the snake!

questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world?
questions.funFact: Vatican City is only 0.44 square kilometers in size!

questions.question: In which year did the first iPhone release?
questions.funFact: The original iPhone had no App Store - it wasn't introduced until 2008!

questions.question: What is the most spoken language in the world?
questions.funFact: Mandarin has over 1.1 billion speakers worldwide!

questions.question: Which video game console is the best-selling of all time?
questions.funFact: The PS2 sold over 155 million units worldwide!

questions.question: What is the chemical formula for table salt?
questions.funFact: The word 'salary' comes from salt, as Roman soldiers were paid with it!

questions.question: Who wrote 'Romeo and Juliet'?
questions.funFact: The play was written between 1591 and 1595, early in Shakespeare's career!

questions.question: What is the fastest land animal?
questions.funFact: Cheetahs can reach speeds of up to 70 mph (112 km/h)!

questions.question: Which company developed the first successful web browser?
questions.funFact: Netscape Navigator was released in 1994 and dominated the browser market in the early web!

questions.question: What percentage of the human body is water?
questions.funFact: The percentage varies by age, with babies having a higher percentage than adults!

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.funFact: The war officially ended on September 2, 1945, with Japan's formal surrender.

questions.question: Which country has won the most FIFA World Cup tournaments?
questions.funFact: Brazil has won the World Cup 5 times, in 1958, 1962, 1970, 1994, and 2002!

questions.question: Which band released the album 'Abbey Road'?
questions.funFact: The album's cover features the famous zebra crossing outside Abbey Road Studios!

questions.question: Which country invented pizza?
questions.funFact: The first modern pizza was created in Naples in the late 18th century!

questions.question: What was the first feature-length animated movie?
questions.funFact: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs was released in 1937 by Disney!
